data.meta_site_name: Voss & Sons Funeral & Cremation Services | Celebrating Every Life Lived
data.text:
Mr. Robert W. Cupp, 96, of Seymour, passed away on Saturday January 16, 2021 at the Lutheran Community Home in Seymour, Indiana. Born in Mt. Carmel, IL on November 11, 1924, he was the son of Clyde and Lenore (Wood) Cupp.

On May 7, 1950, in North Vernon, IN he married Betty Lu Edith Helm who preceded him in death March 16, 2012.

Mr. Cupp was a member of Central Christian Church since 1952 where he served as Chairman of the Board and as Elder for several years. He served in the US Navy for 3 years from 1943 to 1946. He was employed by the Indiana State Police as a radio operator/technician from 1950 to 1972 when he retired. He then took employment with Cummins Engine Company as a security supervisor from 1972 until his retirement in 1983. Mr. Cupp was a member of Jackson Lodge 146 F & AM since September 1946, also serving as Past Master during the year of 2002. He was a member of the Scottish Rite, a member of American Legion # 89, and a past member of the Elks Lodge # 462.

He is survived by his children, Marcia Cupp, Julia Snider, Mark (Phyllis) Cupp, Cynthia (Roger) Follett, grandchildren, Kristen Robinson, Suzanne Wilson, Shannon Pratt, Kelsey Follett, Elizabeth Burgess, Matthew Cupp, Andrew Cupp, great grandchildren, Baylee Chandler, Carlee Robinson, Cory Robinson, Cody Wilson, Shelby Wilson, Leo Cupp, and Oliver Pratt. Great great grandchild Katchyr Logan Chandler.

He was preceded in death by his parents, wife, and brother, James Cupp.

All services are private for family members only.

The family appreciates all the prayers and concern for them in this time of loss. Bob will be missed by many friends in the community. Cards and notes of condolence will be most welcome. All services will be private for family members only.

In accordance with CDC guidelines, masks are required before admittance to the Voss and Sons Funeral Service as well as social distancing within the building. We kindly ask that there be no physical contact such as hugs or handshakes to protect staff and the family. Attendance is limited to 25 and social distancing requirements.

Please visit the funeral home website at www.vossfuneralservice.com to leave condolences to the family.

Memorials may be written to Central Christian Church.

A complete obituary may be viewed on the funeral home Website at www.vossfuneralservice.com
